title: Brook blitz ends Sri Lanka’s unbeaten home run, England clinch series
byline: Harry Brook’s blistering 57-ball hundred proved the difference as England romped to a famous 53-run victory over Sri Lanka on Tuesday to clinch the series and end the hosts’ five-year-long unbeaten ODI home run.

title: South Korea’s ex-first lady jailed 20 months for bribery
byline: The wife of South Korea’s ousted former president has been sentenced to 20 months in jail for accepting bribes from the controversial Unification Church.

title: CAA busts businessman selling fake “Japanese brand” electric fans in Piliyandala
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has apprehended a businessman selling counterfeit electric fans by exploiting consumer trust in Japanese brand names. The raid, carried out in the Piliyandala area, revealed that the fans lacked any verifiable information regarding a legitimate importer or manufacturer.

title: Arijit Singh says he’s not done with music
byline: Popular Bollywood singer Arijit Singh, who wooed generations with his soulful voice in songs like Tum Hi Ho, Kesariya and Channa Mereya, left fans stunned after announcing that he will no longer take up new assignments as a playback vocalist. While calling time on one chapter of his career, Arijit made it clear that he is not stepping away from music itself.

title: GMOA warns of intensified TU action if issues remain unresolved
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) warned that it would step up trade union action if the government fails to take swift measures to address its demands.

title: Opposition conferring on bringing no faith motion against Speaker
byline: Political parties  in the Opposition are conferring on  bringing a no-confident motion against Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) General Secretary and national list MP Ranjith Madduma Bandara said today.

title: Namal holds talks with Karnataka Chief Minister in Bangalore
byline: National Organizer of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), Namal Rajapaksa met with Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah today at the Chief Minister’s official residence in Bangalore.

title: Slightly unhealthy air in Jaffna and Puttalam; Moderate levels elsewhere
byline: Air quality across most parts of Sri Lanka remained at moderate levels over the past 24 hours, while slightly unhealthy conditions were reported in Jaffna and Puttalam, the National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) said.

title: Harsha Abeywickrama resigns as Chairman of Airport & Aviation Services
byline: Air Chief Marshal Harsha Abeywickrama has resigned from his position as the Chairman of Airport & Aviation Services Sri Lanka (Private) Ltd.

title: Over 223,000 tourists arrive in first 25 days of 2026
byline: A total of 223,645 tourists arrived in the country during the first 25 days of the year, according to the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA).

title: Compensation cheques issued to Ditwah victims bounce for lack of funds
byline: Cheques issued as compensation for houses destroyed in the Ditwah disaster in the Rajangana colony have reportedly been dishonoured due to insufficient funds, raising concerns among affected residents. The cheques were ceremonially handed over to beneficiaries by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake during a programme held from January 16 to 17, at which the President also laid the foundation stone for the construction of one of the houses.

title: Issues in coal has reduced the capacity of Norochcholai plant: Official
byline: The capacity of generating power in the Lakvijaya Power Plant, Norochcholai has affected as a result of inferior quality coal, Plant Manager P. W. Bamunusinghe revealed yesterday.

title: Rebuilding Sri Lanka, but are we rebuilding people’s lives? TPA’s Barath Arullsamy questions
byline: Barath Arullsamy, Vice President of the Democratic People’s Front - Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA), in a statement, questioned whether the government’s “Rebuild Sri Lanka” initiative is translating into real change on the ground or remaining largely at the level of words and announcements.

title: Husband arrested over petrol attack on wife
byline: An individual who hurled petrol and set his wife on fire, causing her serious burn injuries, was arrested by Girandurukotte Police yesterday. The suspect had surrendered to the police after the incident.

title: Deputy chief minister of India’s Maharashtra dies in plane crash
byline: The deputy chief minister of India’s western state of Maharashtra, Ajit Pawar, was killed on Wednesday as his charter aircraft went down in flames, television channels said.

title: Police raise alarm over drug-laced sweets aimed at students
byline: The Sri Lanka Police have sounded a severe alarm regarding a disturbing trend where dangerous narcotics are being disguised as popular confectionery items to target schoolchildren.

title: Ranil’s case over Rs. 16.6 Mn misuse to be taken up today
byline: The case filed against former President Ranil Wickremesinghe over allegations of misusing Rs. 16.6 million in public funds for a private overseas trip is scheduled to be taken up again today at 1.30 p.m. before the Fort Magistrate’s Court.

title: HRCSL summons IGP, senior Police officials
byline: The Inspector General of Police (IGP) and four other senior police officials including the Ratnapura Senior DIG, Embilipitiya SSP, Embilipitiya ASP and the OIC of the Embilipitiya Police have been summoned to appear before the Ratnapura office of the Human Rights Commission on February 03 in connection with a human rights petition against them.

title: “Ship might have sailed” – Joe Root on T20I future
byline: In a commanding display of experience and skill, Joe Root guided England to a decisive victory in the 3rd ODI against Sri Lanka, securing the series win. The veteran batter, who registered yet another century in Asian conditions, anchored the innings after a sluggish start, building crucial partnerships with Jacob Bethell and captain Harry Brook.

title: Sri Lanka to seek leniency from EU for GSP+
byline: Given the impact of cyclone Ditwah, which caused US $ 4.1 billion damage, Sri Lanka is to seek redress from the European Union in its evaluation of the country’s eligibility for GSP+ trade facility under the new criterion that will come into effect after 2027, an official said yesterday.

title: Govt. to adopt regulation process if media, social media do not self-regulate
byline: Claiming that the attention of the government has been drawn to the circulation of videos on social media, involving a leading school in Colombo, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said yesterday the government will adopt a regulation process if media and social media do not self-regulate voluntarily on matters concerning privacy and identity of individuals.

title: Sri Lanka mulls social media restrictions for minors
byline: As outrage grows over explicit school-related content spreading unchecked online, the Government is now considering restricting social media access for underage children, raising fresh concerns over digital freedom, censorship, and who ultimately controls what Sri Lankan youth see online.

title: Plan afoot to restore Kalu Ganga mouth and Calido beach
byline: The Cabinet approval has been granted to move ahead with plans to restore the Calido beach, the Kalutara lagoon and the mouth of the Kalu Ganga following severe coastal erosion triggered by flood mitigation measures implemented in 2017.

title: Ranil’s case: Indictments before three-judge bench in March
byline: The Attorney General informed court that indictments will be filed before a three-judge bench of the High Court in March following the completion of the investigations in the case against Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: Sri Lanka T20 team owner sentenced over match-fixing
byline: A Sri Lankan court handed the British owner of a Premier League team a four-year suspended sentence on Wednesday over match-fixing in the domestic T20 cricket tournament, a judicial official told AFP.

title: First Sri Lankan to earn U.S. Navy SEAL Trident passes away
byline: Lieutenant Koyan Chamitha of the Sri Lanka Navy’s elite Special Boat Squadron (SBS), the first Sri Lankan to complete the U.S. Navy SEAL basic training and earn the coveted SEAL Trident, passed away in the early hours of today at the Walisara Wardroom.

title: Saman Ekanayake remanded
byline: Former Presidential Secretary Saman Ekanayake, also known as Somisara Bandara Ekanayake, was ordered to be remanded till February 11 by Colombo Fort Magistrate Isuru Netthikumara.

title: Saman Ekanayake appears before court: Named second suspect
byline: Former Presidential Secretary Somisara Bandara Ekanayake, also known as Saman Ekanayake, appeared before court today.

title: Ranil Wickremesinghe arrives at Fort Magistrate’s Court
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe arrived at the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court a short while ago to appear in connection with a case filed against him under the Public Property Act.

title: Trump warns Iran ’time is running out’ as US military builds up in Gulf
byline: Donald Trump has warned Iran that ’’time is running out’’ to negotiate a deal on its nuclear programme following the steady build-up of US military forces in the Gulf.

title: Pakistan face Australia with T20 World Cup participation uncertain
byline: Pakistan take on Australia in a three-match Twenty20 international series starting in Lahore from Thursday, despite doubts over their participation in next month’s World Cup in cricket’s shortest format.

title: Rebuilding will be done without reversing gains- Govt tells IMF
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) which concluded its latest mission to Sri Lanka said that the authorities are committed to safeguarding the gains that were achieved on fiscal and debt sustainability in rebuilding after the disaster caused by the cyclone.

title: Notices ordered on Gota, others in FR petition on Aragalaya compensation payment
byline: The Supreme Court today directed notices to be served on former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and several others over a Fundamental Rights petition seeking an investigation into the compensation payments made for property damages caused during the attacks and violence that occurred on May 9, 2022.

title: ASPI edges higher as profit-taking keeps market range-bound
byline: The Colombo stock market closed on a mixed note today, with the All Share Price Index (ASPI) ending marginally higher, while the S&P SL20 edged slightly lower. Overall sentiment remained subdued, as profit-taking continued to dominate trading activity, keeping the market in a consolidation phase near all-time high levels without a clear directional trend.

title: Opposition demands cancellation of coal purchase contract
byline: Opposition MPs who visited the Lakwijeya Power Plant in Norochcholai have urged the government to cancel the contract for purchasing coal, citing procedural norms and concerns over coal quality.

title: Bangladesh Slam ICC Over 'Unfair' U19 WC Scheduling After Exit
byline: The Bangladesh vs ICC conflict escalates as the Under-19 team criticises the ICC for an unfair travel schedule.

title: No loss from substandard coal shipment; USD 2.1 million fine imposed: Lanka Coal Company
byline: Claiming that a fine of USD 2.1 million has been imposed on the Indian supplier responsible for supplying substandard coal, General Manager of Lanka Coal Company Namal Hewage said that no loss has been caused to the country due to the substandard coal shipment.

title: Migration of Mahaweli, Irrigation managers worsened Ditwah impact: Former Minister
byline: Former Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka has warned that the migration of experienced middle-level managers from institutions such as the Mahaweli Authority and the Department of Irrigation may have contributed to the severe impact of Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Need to examine Sajith’s mentality before implementing new education reforms; Nalinda
byline: Mass Media Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa today said the Government must first examine the mentality of Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa before responding to his demands on the new education reforms.

title: No child should be left behind in education, Says Prime Minister
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, also serving as Minister of Education, emphasized that the government believes no child’s education should be determined by their parents’ financial situation and that every child has the right to education.

title: Trump warns Iran ’time is running out’ as US military builds up in Gulf
byline: Donald Trump has warned Iran that ’’time is running out’’ to negotiate a deal on its nuclear programme following the steady build-up of US military forces in the Gulf.

title: Sri Lanka Announce T20I Squad: Shanaka Captain, Pavan Included
byline: Sri Lanka have announced their squad for the upcoming three-match T20I series, with Dasun Shanaka set to lead the side as captain.
